U+12FAx   ğ’¾    ğ’¾¡   ğ’¾¢   ğ’¾£   ğ’¾¤   ğ’¾¥   ğ’¾¦   ğ’¾§   ğ’¾¨   ğ’¾©   ğ’¾ª   ğ’¾«   ğ’¾¬   ğ’¾­   ğ’¾®   ğ’¾¯
U+12FBx   ğ’¾°   ğ’¾±   ğ’¾²   ğ’¾³   ğ’¾´   ğ’¾µ   ğ’¾¶   ğ’¾·   ğ’¾¸   ğ’¾¹   ğ’¾º   ğ’¾»   ğ’¾¼   ğ’¾½   ğ’¾¾   ğ’¾¿
U+12FCx   ğ’¿€   ğ’¿   ğ’¿‚   ğ’¿ƒ   ğ’¿„   ğ’¿…   ğ’¿†   ğ’¿‡   ğ’¿ˆ   ğ’¿‰   ğ’¿Š   ğ’¿‹   ğ’¿Œ   ğ’¿   ğ’¿   ğ’¿
U+12FDx   ğ’¿   ğ’¿‘   ğ’¿’   ğ’¿“   ğ’¿”   ğ’¿•   ğ’¿–   ğ’¿—   ğ’¿˜   ğ’¿™   ğ’¿š   ğ’¿›   ğ’¿œ   ğ’¿   ğ’¿   ğ’¿Ÿ
U+12FEx   ğ’¿    ğ’¿¡   ğ’¿¢   ğ’¿£   ğ’¿¤   ğ’¿¥   ğ’¿¦   ğ’¿§   ğ’¿¨   ğ’¿©   ğ’¿ª   ğ’¿«   ğ’¿¬   ğ’¿­   ğ’¿®   ğ’¿¯
U+12FFx   ğ’¿°   ğ’¿±   ğ’¿²   



Unlike many other neighboring states, the Late Bronze Age collapse had only a slight impact on
Bronze Age Cyprus; in fact, the island culture flourished in the period immediately following the dramatic
events of the collapse, and there was a visible increase in the use of the script in such centers
as Enkomi. On the other hand, as a direct result of this collapse, the script ceased to exist in
Ugarit, along with Ugarit itself.

Suggested Syllabary KF-2023 based on similar forms:

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cypro-Minoan_syllabary#/media/File:Cyprominoansyllabaryconsensus.png


Entries with â€¢ are very tenuous additions by the author (pannous)
Entries with â€¢ are suggestion by the author (pannous)
Entries may omit the â€¢ if they seem well supported, like ğ’¿¬ â‰ˆ ğ ” ma, ğ’¿® â‰ˆ ğ • me, ğ’¾¯ â‰ˆ ğ ˜ mu

Cypriotic 900 BC - 300 BC

Orthographic variation: small lines are interchangable with dots	Ì‡ Ìˆ Ì¤ in all signs:
ğ’¿¦ = ğ€€Ì‡ , ğ’¿© = XÌ‡ ,  ğ’¾¸ = VÌ¤ , ğ’¾¹ = WÌ¤   ğ’¾¨ ğ’¾¢ ğ’¾® ğ’¾¬ ğ’¾­ ğ’¾¬ ğ’¾­ ğ’¾« ğ’¾ª ğ’¿€ ğ’¿ ğ’¿‚ ğ’¿ƒ ğ’¿„ ğ’¿… ğ’¿ˆ ğ’¿‰  ğ’¿œ ğ’¿­ ğ’¿® ğ’¿§ ğ’¿¨ ğ’¾¯ ğ’¿± 
ğ’¾¼ = â²’Ìˆ , ğ’¿ƒ = VÌˆ ?

Continuum between lines, split lines and â€œfat tear tailâ€ | ê‡ Â¦ âº â» simplification or ornamentation?

Continuum between open and closed wedges ğ’¿ƒ = ğ ƒ lines often disconnected as in ğ’¾› â‰ˆ ãƒ ã‡µ

Since (later) Cypriotic is a pure Syllabary without any logographs, we can make assumptions about unmatched signs either belonging to a xenotic series ( x / z ) or being Orthographic variants:
